description_txt: stated on January 14, 2010 in in a Republican gubernatorial debate:
quote_txt: “The largest tax increase that we have ever had in our state is yours – it is the business margins tax that you signed, governor.”

description_txt: stated on August 28, 2009 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: The Democrats' health care bills would provide "free health care for illegal immigrants."

description_txt: stated on August 28, 2009 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: The House health care bill provides for "free abortion services, and probably forced participation in abortions by members of the medical profession."

description_txt: stated on January 18, 2010 in a comment on his radio show.:
quote_txt: There are "high administrative costs" when you donate to Haiti relief through the White House Web site.

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2010 in a segment on NBC's Today show:
quote_txt: In Massachusetts, Scott Brown's Republican affiliation is "not a secret, but clearly not on display."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2010 in a speech to House Democrats.:
quote_txt: "The Washington Times ... pointed out that we had succeeded where previous administrations had failed" on spending cuts.

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2010 in a televised interview:
quote_txt: "The No. 1 issue that the American people care about is getting America back to work."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2009 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Health care reform: "Everything about it is going to raise costs, raise taxes and lower the quality of health care."

description_txt: stated on January 4, 2010 in a speech:
quote_txt: "Most Texans aren't millionaires."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2010 in a video blog post:
quote_txt: Chile ranks third internationally in economic freedom, while the U.S. ranks 17th.

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2010 in comments on the subject over the past 10 years.:
quote_txt: On abortion rights.

description_txt: stated on January 17, 2010 in a speech in Boston:
quote_txt: On the importance of an independent voting record

quote_txt: "The Trans-Texas Corridor is dead."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2010 in an interview with Glenn Beck:
quote_txt: "Close to half of the folks in this country illegally entered legally (but) overstayed (their ) visas."

description_txt: stated on January 17, 2010 in on ABC's This Week:
quote_txt: Obama's job approval rating is up.

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2010 in the Jan. 14 GOP gubernatorial debate:
quote_txt: Says Gov. Rick Perry was for Wall Street bailout before he was against it.

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2010 in the Washington Post:
quote_txt: The Obama administration "raised discretionary spending by 24 percent from President George W. Bush's last full-year budget and will run up more debt by October than Bush did in eight years."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2010 in an op-ed in the Washington Post.:
quote_txt: When President Bush took office in 2001, he inherited a $236 billion budget surplus, with a projected 10-year surplus of $5.6 trillion. When he ended his term, he left a $1.3 trillion deficit and a projected 10-year shortfall of $8 trillion.

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2010 in a debate.:
quote_txt: Says Kay Bailey Hutchison voted for sanctuary cities.

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2010 in a debate.:
quote_txt: "We definitely lost way more jobs in Texas this year than we gained — we lost 300,000 jobs in Texas alone this year."

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2010 in response to questions about fundraising totals:
quote_txt: "No Democratic campaign for (Fla.) governor has ever had these kinds of resources this early on in an election cycle."

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: Says Land Commissioner Jerry Patterson threatened to shoot him.

description_txt: stated on October 5, 2009 in news release:
quote_txt: Says Rick Perry's "Pay to Play" politics led him to send $899 million to an offshore call center in Bermuda, driving down enrollment in children's health insurance

description_txt: stated on December 20, 2009 in in a press release:

description_txt: stated on December 29, 2009 in press release:
quote_txt: "More than 1,000 people ... move to Texas every day."

description_txt: stated on January 4, 2010 in an interview on 'The O'Reilly Factor':

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2010 in a television interview:
